fields.headline: Critics choice
fields.bodyText: The web Literacy: onomatopoeia www.abcteach.com/Writing/onomatopoeia.htm Suitable for: KS2 teachers Pupils are reminded what onomatopoeia is and have a chance to brainstorm and write down examples. They can use their words in sentences and in a short comic strip. www.aleeya.net/word-play/onomatopoeia/onomatopoeia/ Suitable for: KS2 teachers This is a superb list of onomatopoeic words compiled by a computer technician and added to by contributors. www.readwritethink.org/lessons/lesson_view.asp?id=909 Suitable for: KS2 teachers & pupils A short lesson plan is provided, but the highlight here is a set of sounds that pupils can listen to and describe. Select "exploring onomatopoeia interactive", under the resources heading. There is a worksheet suitable for more able pupils and links to poems that use onomatopoeia. www.timesonline.co.uk/newspaper/0,,175-1213674,00.html Suitable for: KS2 teachers An article on the growing effect of English onomatopoeia on other languages. http://library.thinkquest.org/J0112392/omomatopoea.html Suitable for: KS2 teachers & pupils Short poems that make use of onomatopoeia. At the bottom of the page, pupils are invited to practise what they have learned. This link will take them to some phrases from which onomatopoeic stanzas are selected for online marking.
